message.content:
cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.Distributed, cs.DB, cs.PL 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - This paper proposes a novel approach to increase the throughput of blockchain architectures by splitting the work traditionally assigned to cryptocurrency miners into two different node roles. This involves distributing the work of consensus and computation among different nodes, which falls under the scope of distributed computing. 
2. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) - The paper discusses the security implications of separating consensus and computation in blockchain architectures and provides a proof of security for the proposed approach. This falls under the scope of cryptography and security. 
3. cs.Distributed (Distributed Computing) - The paper proposes a distributed approach to increase the throughput of blockchain architectures, which falls under the scope of distributed computing. 
4. cs.DB (Databases) - The paper discusses the limitations of existing blockchain architectures and proposes a novel approach to address the throughput limitations. This involves managing and processing large amounts of data, which falls under the scope of databases. 
5. cs.PL (Programming Languages) - The paper discusses the programming model of blockchain architectures and how the proposed approach enables established programming paradigms for smart contracts to persist without introducing additional complexity. This falls under the scope of programming languages.
